types.ParsedCellReference: fields: sheetName string|null, row number, column number, rowAbsolute boolean, columnAbsolute boolean
types.Cell: fields: value any, formula string, format object, dependencies Set<string>
types.DependencyGraph: fields: nodes Map<string, Cell>, edges Map<string, Set<string>>
types.Spreadsheet: fields: grid Map<number, Map<number, Cell>>, selection {row: number, col: number}, viewport {topRow: number, leftCol: number, height: number, width: number}, history Array<HistoryEntry>, historyIndex number
types.CellFormat: fields: numberFormat string, decimalPlaces number, alignment string, bold boolean, italic boolean
types.HistoryEntry: fields: action string, cellAddress string, previousState any, newState any
types.VirtualGrid: fields: containerElement HTMLElement, spreadsheet Spreadsheet, cellPool Array<Array<HTMLElement>>, currentViewport object, selection object, editInput HTMLInputElement or null, CELL_HEIGHT number, CELL_WIDTH number, VIEWPORT_ROWS number, VIEWPORT_COLUMNS number
types.ParsedFormula: fields: ast ASTNode, dependencies Set<string>, originalString string, hasErrors boolean, errorMessage string|null
types.Token: fields: type TokenType, value any, position number
types.ASTNode: union type with NumberNode, CellReferenceNode, BinaryOpNode, UnaryOpNode, FunctionCallNode, RangeNode, ErrorNode
types.BinaryOpNode: fields: operator '+|-|*|/', left ASTNode, right ASTNode
types.FormulaParser: fields: tokens Array<Token>, position number, currentToken Token
types.AdvancedFeaturesManager: fields: spreadsheet Spreadsheet, grid VirtualGrid, history HistoryStack, clipboard ClipboardManager, formatManager FormatManager
types.ClipboardData: fields: cells Array<ClipboardCell>, sourceRange object, timestamp number
types.ClipboardCell: fields: value any, formula string|null, format CellFormat|null, originalAddress string
types.ExportOptions: fields: includeFormulas boolean, includeFormatting boolean, range object|null
types.HistoryStack: fields: undoStack Array<Command>, redoStack Array<Command>, maxDepth number
types.SetCellValueCommand: fields: (inherits from Command) cellAddress string, previousState any, newState any
types.SetCellFormulaCommand: fields: (inherits from Command) cellAddress string, previousState any, newState any
types.RecalculationFlow: fields: spreadsheet Spreadsheet, dependencyGraph DependencyGraph, formulaParser FormulaParser
types.DebugLogger: fields: levels Object, currentLevel number, enabledModules Set<string>
types.Workbook: fields: sheets Map<string, Spreadsheet>, activeSheetName string
types.Chart: fields: id string, type string, dataRange string, title string

methods.parseCellAddress(address) returns Parsed: Parse Excel-style cell address with optional sheet name
methods.toCellAddress(row, column, rowAbsolute,: Convert row/column indices to cell address string
methods.isValidCellAddress(address) returns bool: Check if string is valid cell address
methods.columnToLetter(column) returns string: Convert 0-based column index to Excel column letters
methods.letterToColumn(letters) returns number: Convert Excel column letters to 0-based index
methods.parseCellAddress(address) returns: Parse Excel-style cell address into structured format
methods.toCellAddress(row, column, rowAbsolute,: Convert row/column indices to cell address string
methods.isValidCellAddress(address) returns: Check if string is valid cell address
methods.columnToLetter(column) returns: Convert 0-based column index to Excel column letters
methods.letterToColumn(letters) returns: Convert Excel column letters to 0-based index
methods.createEmptyCell() returns: Create a new empty cell with default values
methods.createNumberCell(value) returns: Create a cell with a numeric value
methods.createFormulaCell(formula) returns: Create a cell with a formula
methods.getCell(row, col) returns: Get cell at specified row and column (0-based indices)
methods.setCellValue(row, col, value) returns: Set raw value for a cell (not a formula)
methods.getAllCells() returns: Get all cells that have data (non-empty iterator for efficient traversal)
methods.addDependency(dependentAddress, dependen: Add a dependency relationship: dependentCell depends on dependencyCell
methods.getDependents(cellAddress) returns: Get all cells that directly depend on the given cell
methods.getTopologicalOrder(changedCell) returns: Get topological order for recalculation (dependencies before dependents)
methods.detectCircularReference(startAddress, ta: Detect if adding an edge would create a circular reference
methods.createEmptyCell() returns Cell: Create a new empty cell with default values
methods.createNumberCell(value) returns Cell: Create a cell with a numeric value
methods.createFormulaCell(formula) returns Cell: Create a cell with a formula
methods.getCell(row, col) returns Cell: Get cell at specified row and column (0-based indices)
methods.setCellValue(row, col, value) returns vo: Set raw value for a cell (not a formula)
methods.getAllCells() returns Generator<[number,: Get all cells that have data (non-empty iterator for efficient traversal)
methods.addDependency(dependentAddress, dependen: Add a dependency relationship: dependentCell depends on dependencyCell
methods.getDependents(cellAddress) returns Set<s: Get all cells that directly depend on the given cell
methods.getTopologicalOrder(changedCell) returns: Get topological order for recalculation (dependencies before dependents)
methods.detectCircularReference(startAddress, ta: Detect if adding an edge would create a circular reference
methods.initializeGrid() returns void: Mounts the grid into the specified container DOM element
methods.renderViewport() returns void: Updates all visible cells to reflect the current viewport position
methods.setSelection(row number, col number) ret: Visually highlights the specified cell as selected
methods.enterEditMode(row number, col number, in: Replaces the cell display with an editable input field
methods.scrollToCell(row number, col number) ret: Adjusts the viewport to make the specified cell visible
methods.parseFormula(formulaString, contextCellA: Main entry point for parsing formulas
methods.extractDependencies(node) returns Set<st: Traverses AST to collect cell references
methods.resolveRange(rangeExpression, contextCel: Expands range into individual cell addresses
methods.initialize(spreadsheet, grid) returns vo: Sets up internal references and attaches event listeners
methods.handleCopy(sourceRange) returns Clipboar: Extracts cells from specified range, serializes with metadata
methods.handlePaste(targetAddress, clipboardData: Pastes cells at target location, adjusting relative references
methods.undo() returns boolean: Reverts the most recent change, returns success status
methods.redo() returns boolean: Reapplies the most recent undone change
methods.exportToCSV(options) returns string: Converts spreadsheet data to CSV format string
methods.importFromCSV(csvString, startAddress) r: Parses CSV and inserts data starting at specified cell
methods.removeFormat(address, formatProperty) re: Removes formatting (or specific properties) from cell(s)
methods.push(command) returns void: Adds command to undo stack and clears redo stack
methods.undo() returns Command|null: Pops and returns most recent command from undo stack
methods.redo() returns Command|null: Pops and returns most recent command from redo stack
methods.adjustFormula(formula, sourceAddress, ta: Adjusts relative references in formula based on displacement
methods.escapeCSVValue(value) returns string: Properly escapes a value for CSV format
methods.parseCSVLine(line) returns Array<string>: Parses a CSV line into array of values

methods.createMockSpreadsheet(cellDefinitions): Creates a mock spreadsheet with predefined cell values
methods.mockValueResolver(address): Mock value resolver for formula evaluation tests
methods.expandRange(start, end): Returns all cell addresses in a range (inclusive)
methods.configure(config) returns void: Configure logging level and enabled modules
methods.log(module, level, message, data) return: Log message if module is enabled and level sufficient
methods.visualizeGraph(graph, highlightCell) ret: Generate textual representation of dependency graph
methods.toCellAddress(row, column, rowAbsolute,: Convert row/column and optional sheet name to cell address string
methods.ChartManager.addChart(chart) returns voi: Add a chart and register its dependencies

constants.ERRORS: Object containing error message constants: CIRCULAR_REF, REF_ERROR, VALUE_ERROR, DIV_ZERO, PARSE_ERROR
constants.TokenType: enum: NUMBER, CELL_REF, OPERATOR, FUNCTION, LEFT_PAREN, RIGHT_PAREN, COMMA, COLON, EOF
constants.DEBUG: Global flag for enabling debug code

terms.reactive dataflow: System where outputs automatically update when inputs change
terms.topological sort: Linear ordering of nodes where dependencies come before dependents
terms.dependency graph: Directed graph showing which cells depend on which other cells
terms.virtual scrolling: Rendering only visible elements while simulating full scrollable content
terms.circular reference: Dependency chain that leads back to itself (A→B→C→A)
terms.dirty flag: Marker indicating a cell needs recalculation
terms.relative reference: Cell reference that adjusts when copied (A1)
terms.absolute reference: Cell reference that doesn't adjust when copied ($A$1)
terms.viewport: Visible portion of the larger virtual grid
terms.separation of concerns: Design principle separating a program into distinct sections with minimal overlap
terms.dependency injection: Pattern where dependencies are provided to a component rather than created internally
terms.adjacency list: Graph representation where each node has a list of its adjacent nodes
terms.sparse array: Data structure that only stores elements that have values, saving memory
terms.DOM recycling: Reusing existing DOM elements for different logical content
terms.event delegation: Attaching event listeners to a parent element instead of individual child elements
terms.lexical analysis: Process of converting character stream into tokens
terms.recursive descent: Parsing technique that uses mutually recursive functions
terms.operator precedence: Rules defining which operators are evaluated first
terms.type coercion: Automatic conversion between data types during evaluation
terms.memoization: Caching parsed results to avoid redundant work
terms.command pattern: Design pattern that encapsulates operations as objects for undo/redo functionality
terms.reference adjustment: Process of modifying cell references when formulas are copied/moved
terms.CSV (Comma-Separated Values): Simple file format for tabular data using commas as separators
terms.format preset: Predefined set of formatting properties with a name for reuse
terms.displacement vector: The row and column differences between source and target locations
terms.batch operation: Group of individual operations treated as a single atomic action
terms.compound command: A command that groups multiple atomic commands for batch undo/redo
terms.deep copy: Creating a complete duplicate of an object, including nested objects
terms.shallow reference: Storing only a reference to an object rather than duplicating it
terms.error propagation: Process where errors in source cells cause errors in dependent cells
terms.edge case: Unusual but valid scenario requiring special handling
terms.syntax validation: Checking formula structure conforms to grammatical rules
terms.semantic validation: Checking formula meaning is valid (references exist, types match)
terms.round-trip consistency: Property where exporting then re-importing data preserves all information
terms.mock: Test double that simulates behavior of real objects
terms.integration test: Test that verifies interactions between multiple components
terms.end-to-end test: Test that verifies complete user workflows through the UI
terms.debug visualization: Making internal data structures and processes visible for debugging
terms.formula tracing: Step-by-step logging of formula evaluation process
terms.recalculation flow monitoring: Tracking the order and results of cell recalculations
terms.state inspection: Examining complete cell state including value, formula, and metadata
terms.test scenario recorder: Tool that records user interactions for later replay
terms.performance profiling hooks: Instrumentation to measure execution time and resource usage
terms.worksheet: A single sheet within a workbook
terms.cross-sheet reference: A cell reference that includes a sheet name prefix
terms.operational transformation: Algorithm for maintaining consistency in collaborative editors
terms.function registry: Centralized map of function names to their implementations
terms.chart node: A special node in the dependency graph representing a chart
